node.title: U.K. is 1st country to okay use of Merck antiviral drug for COVID-19
node.description: The drugmaker is also seeking emergency approval in the U.S. and Europe for the first pill shown to treat the coronavirus, and it's sharing its formula.

node.title: Review: ‘This Is Not a War Story,’ Nor Does Coming Home Mean Peace
node.description: This poignant drama directed by and starring Talia Lugacy follows a traumatized Marine as she tries to connect with a group of fellow veterans at home.

node.title: ‘Mark, Mary & Some Other People’ Review: Till Death Do They Waffle
node.description: In this romantic comedy, a couple opens their relationship to prove they can be married and modern.

node.title: ‘All Is Forgiven’ Review: A Distinctive First Feature
node.description: A father with a drug problem tries to reconnect with his daughter.

node.title: ‘Finch’ Review: Three for the Road
node.description: Tom Hanks, a dog and two robots take a post-apocalyptic road trip in this unexciting drama from Apple TV+.

node.title: ‘The Beta Test’ Review: Paranoia in Hollywood
node.description: Jim Cummings stars as a phony talent agent who agrees to an anonymous sexual encounter in this unruly satire.

node.title: ‘A Cop Movie’ Review: When a Uniform Is a Costume
node.description: This strange and ambitious Mexican film plays like a combination of “Cops,” “F for Fake” and “When Harry Met Sally.”

node.title: ‘Beans’ Review: Growing Up Fast in the ’90s

node.title: Watch Incredible Moment Baby Zebra Shark Hatches From Mermaid's Purse
node.description: TikTok video showing the black and white baby shark emerging has been viewed over four million times.

node.title: Woman Found Shot Dead In Driveway, Fiancé Charged With Murder
node.description: Tereyl Devon Coleman, 29, was arrested after Raven Coleman was found dead with a gunshot wound to the chest in the driveway of a residence in Detroit.

node.title: 'It's all a bit of fun': Giant potato called Doug unearthed in New Zealand
node.description: Weighing in at almost 8 kilograms, Doug the potato vies for the heavyweight title in the Guinness World Records, after being unearthed by a New Zealand couple in August.

node.title: How young is too young to teach kids about race?
node.description: A culture war has erupted over critical race theory and how schools should grapple with the history of race and racism in America.

node.title: Jury views dramatic video of Kyle Rittenhouse fatally shooting man
node.description: Jurors peered at infrared video made by an FBI surveillance plane from almost 9,000 feet above the spot where the teen fatally shot Joseph Rosenbaum.

node.title: What’s the Matter With Scarsdale?
node.description: Democrats’ struggles with working-class voters seem to be getting worse.

node.title: Joe Biden Endorsement Destroyed Democrat Chances, GOP Virginia House Winner Says
node.description: GOP candidate AC Cordoza scored a surprise victory against incumbent Democratic delegate Martha Mugler in the 91st district race on November 3.

node.title: Prostate Cancer Symptoms Explained As Joe Exotic Says He Has Aggressive Form of Disease
node.description: The central character of Netflix's "Tiger King" series announced he is suffering from a major cause of death in American men.

node.title: For the Astros, a Stinging Loss and an Uncertain Future
node.description: Houston’s experience couldn’t save it in the World Series. With Carlos Correa hinting he might leave, there is no telling what the team might look like next season.

node.title: With Mammoth Blasts, Jorge Soler Wins World Series M.V.P.
node.description: He was hitting .192 when Atlanta traded for him and missed time with the coronavirus. But Soler’s homers put his team ahead in three games in the series.

node.title: Manhattan Valley: A ‘More Affordable Pocket of the Upper West Side’
node.description: Residents treasure this attainable neighborhood near the top of Central Park, where ‘everyone has an interesting story to tell.’

node.title: The Marathon Returns to a City Eager to Celebrate It
node.description: Runners, organizers and spectators are preparing for New York’s first marathon since the onset of the pandemic, another milestone in the city’s long journey of recovery.

node.title: The Heart and Soul of a Franchise Shines Through
node.description: Freddie Freeman might have played his final game for Atlanta on Tuesday. Even if he did, he has already delivered on a promise he made to honor his mother.

node.title: Auckland councillors divided over proposed housing density law
node.description: Auckland councillors are divided over proposed new rules that would make it easier to build houses in the city.

node.title: Anti-Muslim bias prompted city to reject mosque, ACLU suit claims
node.description: The lawsuit alleges that aldermen in the northern Mississippi city of Horn Lake turned down an application to build the mosque due to prejudice and asks that the decision be reversed.

node.title: OPEC and Russia will ponder oil output under pressure from Biden.
node.description: At a meeting on Thursday, big oil producers are likely to juggle U.S. ties, climate change pressures and their own economics.

node.title: 5 Takeaways from the First Days of the Climate Summit
node.description: The world leaders have left Glasgow. Now negotiators must hunker down to turn pledges into reality.

node.title: A 'McCarthy-Like Web': Jones Bans NBC From Jonestown
node.description: Jim Jones didn't want NBC in Jonestown partly because he had undergone a huge change thanks to his lifestyle of drink and drugs.

node.title: Adorable Puppy Rescued After Almost Drowning in Shipwreck Off Alaska
node.description: The eight-month-old pup had been thrown into freezing water when her owner's fishing vessel capsized near Sitkalidak Island.

node.title: Who Was Charles K. Kao? Today's Google Doodle Celebrates Physicist's Birth
node.description: The British-American physicist, born in Shanghai on November 4, 1933, was known for laying the foundation for high-speed data communication.

node.title: Tulsi Gabbard Calls Glenn Youngkin's Virginia Win a 'Victory for All Americans'
node.description: The former democratic representative and presidential candidate seemed to take swipes at Terry McAuliffe's stance on the critical race theory debate.

node.title: It took three years for Department of Child Protection to pass report on teen's suicide to state coroner
node.description: An independent report looking into a decision to remove a boy from his foster care home and into residential care before he took his own life, has just been handed to the state coroner, despite being commissioned more than three years ago.

node.title: T20 live: Aussies face Bangladesh in must-win World Cup encounter
node.description: Australia's campaign at the men's T20 World Cup is on the line, as Justin Langer's side attempts to keep its semi-final hopes alive. Follow our ScoreCentre.

node.title: Principal knocked unconscious, allegedly by student, in Boston school
node.description: The principal's injuries are serious but not life-threatening, sources say. The school was to be closed for a day.

node.title: Benedict Cumberbatch and the Monsters Among Us

node.title: Ew, David, Your Book Is a Best Seller!

node.title: John Banville, the Contemporary Novelist Who Avoids Contemporary Novels
node.description: “I read very little new fiction these days, to my shame and regret. ... So much of it seems to me mere prattle. Isn’t that awful?”

node.title: Poem: We Feel Now a Largeness Coming On
node.description: Tracy K. Smith reminds us how “being called all manner of things / from the dictionary of shame,” we do learn to become something mighty.

node.title: Judge John Hodgman on the Uncapped Water Bottle
node.description: A “clumsy fellow” demands his partner be more conscientious with her hydration.

node.description: A look at three spots that have weathered challenges in very different ways.

node.title: Do Gun Rights Depend on Abortion Rights? That’s Now Up to the Supreme Court.
node.description: The outcome of a Texas law targeting abortion will provide the answer.

node.description: The world leaders have left Glasgow. Now negotiators must hunker down to turn pledges into reality.

node.title: Baffert, Barred from Churchill Downs, Is Embraced by the Breeders’ Cup
node.description: The Hall of Fame trainer Bob Baffert has longstanding relationships with many members of the Breeders’ Cup board.

node.title: Bringing Books to Children That Speak Their Language
node.description: Nonprofit groups focused on literacy are encouraging reading and engaging students through culturally relevant stories.

node.title: The Price of Living in ‘Paradise’ Is Higher Than Ever

node.title: How Tyson Foods Got 60,500 Workers to Get the Coronavirus Vaccine Quickly
node.description: The meatpacking giant, which was criticized for failing to do enough to protect its workers from Covid-19 last year, has become a leader on corporate mandates.

node.title: The U.S. Is Reopening. Here’s What Travelers Need to Know About Testing, Boosters and More.

node.title: Do Generations Matter? Well, Maybe.

node.title: Elon Musk’s Extraterrestrial Capitalism
node.description: Billionaires, having read stories of world-building as boys, are now rich enough, as men, to build worlds. The rest of us are trapped in them.

node.title: Republicans Are Going to Use Dog Whistles. Democrats Can’t Just Ignore Them.

node.title: What to Do About Facebook, and What Not to Do

node.title: Center of Italy’s Anti-Vaccine Protests Is Now a Covid Hot Spot

node.title: In Florida, a Firestorm Over Silenced University Professors Grows

node.title: Republicans Gain Ground as N.Y.C. Council Sees Groundbreaking Changes
node.description: Concerns over public safety and frustration over pandemic-related guidelines helped some Republicans seize seats on the New York City Council.

node.title: 5 Things to Do This Weekend
node.description: Our critics and writers have selected noteworthy cultural events to experience virtually and in person in New York City.

node.title: How the New York City Marathon Grew Up

node.title: COP26 Live Updates: End of Coal Power 'In Sight' As Over 40 Countries Agree to Quit
node.description: The end of coal power is "in sight" as over 40 countries agree to quit the polluting power source before 2050 - but major players including the U.S. are refusing to sign up. Follow Newsweek's liveblog for all the latest.

node.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's jail conditions rival Hannibal Lecter's, lawyer claims

node.description: Eric Adams took a victory lap and said he would focus on public safety and the crisis at Rikers Island.

node.title: Did Anyone Win the Powerball Jackpot on 11/3/21? Numbers and Results

node.title: Fox News Called Arizona for Biden, Turning January 6 Into the Day of Reckoning
node.description: A key word used by both sides was "they." "They" believed the election was rigged or alternatively "they" dismissed their foes as brainwashed nuts.

node.title: Carnarvon man Terence Darrell Kelly charged with abducting Cleo Smith

node.title: Baldwin armourer's lawyer claims live bullet could have been slipped into box of dummy rounds
node.description: Lawyers representing the woman who loaded Alec Baldwin's gun claim an act of sabotage by disgruntled crew may have caused the shooting death of Halyna Hutchins last month.

node.title: Fisherman charged with stealing shark detection tag from great white

node.title: South Australia sets 'world first' with five 'negative demand' solar events
node.description: South Australia has set what is believed to be a world record: generating more electricity from solar than they consumed on five occasions in the past five weeks.

node.title: Wellington's Island Bay cycleway still under contention
node.description: Wellington City Council is divided again in trying to solve cycleway issues in Island Bay.

node.title: Department of Justice fined over attacks on staff, including infamous guitar 'scalping'

node.title: Primary school students missing out on online learning
node.description: With primary school students facing more remote learning, principals say some students have been missing out on online classes due to a lack of devices.

node.title: Parents of 'luckiest town in the world' welcome Cleo Smith's 'miracle' rescue

node.title: Families 'floored' as pair of Secret Santas pay off 82 Christmas lay-bys at toyshop
node.description: The couple, who wish to remain anonymous, told the manager of the store that they had vowed to perform such an act of kindness after struggling to pay the bills during their younger years.

node.title: 'I feel ashamed': Former Afghan interpreter fears for his family still stuck in Afghanistan
node.description: Since the fall of Kabul, more than 100,000 Afghans have applied for humanitarian visas. While thousands were evacuated in August, many more remain stuck in Afghanistan.

node.title: Gisborne flooding: Residents told to prepare for evacuation
node.description: Some Gisborne residents are being told to prepare to evacuate as flood levels rise in the waterlogged region. Audio

node.title: Late Night Recaps Democrats’ Stinging Election Results

node.title: Discovery of new breeding pairs gives hope to Granite Island little penguin colony
node.description: Their numbers crashed from 1,600 to 16 in recent years and foxes almost finished the job. Now scientists are celebrating a discovery in a little penguin colony clinging to life on a South Australian island.

node.title: 'Be vigilant, things might get worse' - Gisborne Mayor
node.description: Gisborne's mayor says nobody has yet been forced to leave their homes despite severe flooding in the region prompting a state of emergency being declared. Audio

node.title: Cleo Smith case defies child abduction patterns after 4-year-old found safe - expert
node.description: A criminology expert says Cleo Smith's 18-day disappearance broke "all the rules" of a typical child abduction case.

node.title: Hackers access mySA GOV digital licence accounts, prompting warning from government

node.title: NZDF to continue deployments to North Korea

node.title: Alcohol cheaper than coffee- study
node.description: A person can binge drink for the price of a coffee, an Alcohol Healthwatch study has found.

node.title: Covid-19: Prisons to require proof of vaccination for visitors
node.description: All visitors to New Zealand's prisons will need to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 from next month.

node.title: Victorian Opposition Leader stands by demand for drink-driving MP Tim Smith to leave Kew seat
node.description: Victorian Opposition Leader Matthew Guy is standing by his public demand that embattled Kew MP Tim Smith not contest next year's state election.

node.title: Former Big Bash player used cricket to build trust with child grooming victims, court hears
node.description: Former professional cricketer Aaron Summers pleads guilty to possessing and sending child abuse material and grooming young boys using Snapchat and Instagram.

node.title: Pentagon warns China is growing its nuclear weapons arsenal faster than predicted

node.title: Melbourne Cup-winning owner fined for COVID-19 breach during Flemington celebrations

node.title: 'Flying cars' duel in outback drag race as developer speeds towards aerial 'grand prix'

node.title: Growing regulation causing added stress for dairy farmers - Survey

node.title: South African author Damon Galgut wins Booker Prize
node.description: Damon Galgut has won the Booker Prize for his portrait of a white South African family "navigating the end of apartheid".

node.title: Porirua City Council commits $17.9m to flood prevention measures
node.description: Porirua City Council has committed $17.9 million to reduce the risk of flooding in Karehana, Plimmerton.
